books.title: The Phantom of the Opera
books.author: Gaston Leroux
books.summary: A mysterious presence terrorizes the Paris Opera.

books.title: El Dorado
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: Two separate interests want to free the imprisoned Dauphin of France.

books.title: Twenty Years at Hull House
books.author: Jane Addams
books.summary: Jane Addams’ autobiographical account of the founding and operation of Hull House, one of America’s most famous settlement homes.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: Hunting for Hidden Gold
books.author: Franklin W. Dixon
books.summary: Two boy sleuths unravel a mystery about stolen gold.

books.title: The Young Visiters
books.author: Daisy Ashford
books.summary: A nine-year-old girl’s humorous depiction of high society, exactly as written in her notebook.

books.title: Troilus and Cressida
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A Trojan prince falls in love with a woman amid the Trojan War, only to see her exchanged to the Greeks for a prisoner of war.

books.title: The Lost World
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: A team of scientists and adventurers explores a prehistoric land.

books.title: Kate Plus 10
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A police inspector investigates an enigmatic young woman and her connection with various criminal activities.

books.title: The Room in the Dragon Volant
books.author: J. Sheridan Le Fanu
books.summary: After an Englishman traveling in France meets a mysterious woman, he becomes embroiled in a dangerous intrigue.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.

books.title: The Midnight Guest
books.author: Fred M. White
books.summary: A brilliant lord struggles to hold his personal life together after his friend’s murder set off a chain of events that threatens to expose his dark secrets.

books.title: Leviathan
books.author: Thomas Hobbes
books.summary: Hobbes explores a vision of the ideal state, in which people cede certain freedoms to a sovereign power in exchange for security and stability.

books.title: The Kural
books.author: Thiruvalluvar
books.summary: An Indian weaver-philosopher expounds on the subjects of righteousness, wealth, and love.

books.title: Eugene Onegin
books.author: Alexander Pushkin
books.summary: A jaded Russian fop’s disdain for the world catches up with him.

books.title: A Woman of No Importance
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A mother’s secretive past clashes with high society when her son is offered an irresistible position with a charismatic nobleman.

books.title: The Big Time
books.author: Fritz Leiber
books.summary: A motley collection of servicemembers escape a plot as two mysterious factions wage an epic war across time itself.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Mack Reynolds
books.summary: A collection of science fiction short stories by Mack Reynolds ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.summary: Dante journeys through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven in order to receive salvation and to find divine love.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.
